column4: i cant get my nvidia to work..i got everything installed correctly.now i stop the x server,run as root nvidia-xconfig or edit xorg.conf replacing "nv" with "nvidia",i start x again by typing "startx" or "sudo invoke-rc.d gdm start" my x wont start at all.it will give me a black blank screen and hang there.
i have to use "nv" again to restart my x server.
why are you not using the restricted driver manager?
same thing happen too
what card
yes, but they are different.  You should ask in #debian
you need to ask in #debian, not here.  Debian and Ubuntu may have different issues and different resolutions
what version of ubuntu
get rid of what envy did, use restricted driver manager, reload X, then drop to a tty and copy /var/log/Xorg.0.log somewhere.  Then pastebin that for us to see
ive uninstalled envy,used restricted to install nvidia but in "Status" says Not in use but the Enabled is ticked
and restarted X?
ah, so it is working now?  Are you actually running the nvidia driver?
in xorg.conf under device driver has "nvidia" but when i select Extra or normal under Visual effects,a box popout saying desktop effects could not be enabled
'glxinfo | grep direct' returns?
Xlib:  extension "GLX" missing on display ":0.0". <-- 7 lines of them and Error: couldn't find RGB GLX visual
hmm, pastebin /etc/X11/xorg.conf and /var/log/Xorg.0.log
pastebin??
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/42224/ |  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/42225/
(EE) Failed to initialize GLX extension (Compatible NVIDIA X driver not found)
nvidia driver not installed?

well X can't find a decent one.  Try purging linux-restricted-modules-$(uname -r) and nvidia-glx*, rebooting and then using restricted driver manager again.  Read very carefully what the outcome of the commands are.  I also don't know what envy does and how to undo it so that is another factor
thanks.will try dat another day coz i really have to go.i guess ure still here tmr?
maybe, someone is always around though
ok thanks again to everybody who had helped me :)
